intro: Cavendishia tarapotana var. tarapotana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a compact, shrub-like appearance with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to cool, humid climates and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
